page.title: 02SHUGBOROUGH HALL
page.content: Shugborough Estate was bought by William Anson in 1623. Thomas Anson later built on the flanking pavillions. The National Trust has owned Shugborough since 1960. There are 18 acres of formal gardens around the house which are a major tourist attraction in this area. Over 80,000 people visit Shugborough each year. The Queen and other members of the Royal Family,as well as many pop-stars have visited the house. We wonder if any of them have met Lady Harriet,the family ghost. Shugborough has approximately 130 rooms,many are in the cellar. Lord Lichfield's family have 45 rooms in their private quarters. In the 9 rooms open to the public there are priceless antiques which give a clear view of the life-style of wealthy people in Georgian times.
